business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open in green over improved global cues; TCS up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 77.47 points to 82,384.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 31.95 points to 25,321.85 as of 9:24 am.

Trump sues JPMorgan Chase, CEO Jamie Dimon for $5bn over alleged debankingDonald Trump has filed a $5 billion lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase for closing his bank accounts. The case raises questions about political bias and banking practices in the US.

Zomato's Deepinder Goyal to return unvested ESOPs as he steps down as Eternal CEOAccording to Goyal, the move strengthens long-term employee retention without adding to shareholder dilution, something that is often a concern during leadership changes.
Sensex ends 398 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; BEL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 397.74 points to close at 82,307.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 132.40 points to end at 25,289.90.

India's banking system is resilient and prepared for global shocks: SBI ChairmanSetty said a key difference between India and many other economies today is the strength of its banking system. He recalled that after the global financial crisis and the subsequent spillovers, India undertook one of the largest clean-ups of bank balance sheets through asset quality reviews and recapitalisation.

India's growth story strong on AI and trade deals, says Tech Mahindra CEOAccording to Mohit Joshi, India's strength lies in execution, i.e., taking complex technologies and applying them at scale across large organisations.

Air India braces for roughly Rs 15,000 crore loss after deadly crash: ReportAir India is expected to post a loss of at least Rs 15,000 crore (about $1.6 billion) for the financial year ending March 31, said the people, who requested anonymity because the information is private.

How might these revisions impact public spending, consumption and long-term fiscal health? Let's have a look.

Shadowfax Technologies IPO enters final day: Price band, GMP and should you apply?The allotment is expected to be finalised on 23 January 2026. Shares are likely to list on both the BSE and NSE on 28 January 2026, subject to market conditions.

Rupee slides to record levels. What the fall means for your daily expensesThe rupee's fall may look like a market story, but its ripple effects travel much further. What happens next could shape prices, travel costs and your monthly budget.

Budget 2026: Agri industry seeks stronger push for sustainability, nutrition and R&DAs India gears up for Union Budget 2026, voices from the agriculture sector are calling for policies that go beyond short-term gains and focus on sustainable farming, food security, better nutrition and stronger support for research and development.

Gold and silver keep soaring to record highs, but is it a boom or a bubble?In 2025, gold delivered its strongest annual gains in nearly 50 years, while silver posted its best returns ever. That strength carried into 2026, with silver crossing the Rs 3,00,000 per kg mark in India.

Tariffs or no tariffs, here's why global CEOs are betting big on IndiaIndia's rise in CEO rankings reflects a simple reality. Global companies want growth, scale and stability, and the numbers show India is delivering more of it than most major markets right now.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as global cues improve: Is the worst finally over?The rebound in Sensex and Nifty may not guarantee stability, but Thursday's sharp turnaround shows the benchmarks are finally finding their footing after weeks of relentless selling.

Harry Styles unveils 2026 tour dates, plans 30-night New York run Harry Styles will embark on the Together Together Tour 2026 in support of his fourth solo album, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally, performing in only seven cities across the globe.

Martin Short accidentally sliced Selena Gomez's wedding cake, mistook it for dessert Martin Short revealed an unexpected incident at Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco's September 2025 wedding, sharing on a recent talk show how he accidentally cut into the main wedding cake before it was officially served. The situation, which occurred at the reception in Santa Barbara, was quickly fixed by the couple's chef.

Ajith's Mankatha beats Vijay's Ghilli in re-release pre-sales, scripts history Ajith Kumar's 2011 film Mankatha recorded the highest pre-sales for a re-release in Tamil Nadu, overtaking the previous record set by Vijay's Ghilli. The action thriller was a milestone film in Ajith's career.

Taylor Swift proves CANCELLED isn't just a song, it's loyalty for BFF Blake Lively Singer Taylor Swift brings the lyrics of her hit song, CANCELLED, to life, standing by Blake Lively amid the controversy of It Ends With Us and proving loyalty goes beyond music.

Tu Ya Main trailer: Adarsh Gourav, Shanaya Kapoor try to escape a deadly crocodile The trailer of Tu Yaa Main shows Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor trapped in a pool with a bloodthirsty crocodile. The film is set for a theatrical release on February 13, 2026.

Karan Johar, Neeraj Ghaywan share emotional notes after Homebound's Oscar exit Karan Johar and Neeraj Ghaywan shared their first social media posts after Homebound missed getting a nomination at the 98th Academy Awards. Karan thanked Neeraj for collaborating with him for the film.

Sinners makes history with 16 nominations at Oscars, One Battle After Another gets 13 Sinners dominated the 2026 Oscar nominations with a historic sixteen nods, setting a new benchmark for excellence. It was followed by the One Battle After Another with thirteen nominations.

Emotional Rani Mukerji recalls Aamir Khan saying her voice was not apt for Ghulam Rani Mukerji celebrated her three-decade career by discussing the significance of her original voice in cinema. She recalled pivotal moments of her legacy with filmmakers Karan Johar and Aamir Khan.

When and where to watch shonen anime Jujutsu Kaisen Season 3 Episode 4 The fourth episode of Jujutsu Kaisen season 3 will be available for streaming on 22 January 2026, offering fans new content, a longer runtime, and dubbed versions across major platforms.

John Abraham didn't know acting but knew his limitations: Rimi Sen on Dhoom co-star Rimi Sen recalled working with John Abraham in Dhoom. She said that John Abraham initially didn't know acting, but hid it intelligently.

A complaint has been filed against him in Sangli, accusing him of cheating a local man of Rs 40 lakh in a failed film investment deal.

Border 2, like Dhurandhar, banned in Gulf countries over India-Pakistan theme Border 2, set for release tomorrow, has been banned in Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE over its perceived 'anti-Pakistan' themes. The move followed recent trends with similar Indian films based on patriotic themes in the region.

general news.headline: Rain, thunderstorm in Delhi-NCR; alert issued for more showers, mercury to fallDelhi, Noida and Ghaziabad witnessed moderate rain on Friday morning amid lingering winter chill, while the AQI in Delhi stayed in the 'very poor' category above 300.

ICE agents detain boy, 5, in Minnesota, school admin claims he was used as baitLiam Conejo Ramos, 5, came from preschool and was detained by masked ICE agents outside of his home. His school claimed the child was used as bait to lure his mother out, who was asked by her husband to stay inside, potentially to avoid detention herself.

22 hospitalised in Indore after drinking contaminated water in fresh spate of casesAt least 22 people have fallen ill in a fresh water contamination outbreak in Indore's Mhow area weeks after a similar crisis killed at least 15.

India avoids Davos optics as Pakistan joins Trump's Board of PeaceUS President Donald Trump launched the Board of Peace at Davos, with Pakistan joining but India staying away, raising questions on the initiative's global acceptance. The new body aims to promote peace and stability, focusing initially on Gaza's reconstruction.

Train Netaji took for escape from British India completes 160-year runAfter choosing armed struggle over a Gandhian non-violent path, one of India's greatest sons, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, left the country forever in January 1941. Executing a detailed plan, Netaji boarded the Kalka Mail, which is India's oldest express train and would soon complete 160 years.

Missing corporator returns, says I'm and will always be with Uddhav ThackeraySarita Mhaske, the lone corporator who was "incommunicado" from the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, returned along with her husband on Thursday after 24 hours. Thackeray loyalist and UBT MLC Milind Narvekar led efforts to find the couple.

Amazon set to announce mass layoffs next week, around 16000 jobs on the lineWe are still in the first month of 2026 and the layoffs counter for the year is already fairly high. Amazon is expected to slash around 16,000 jobs next week. The cuts are expected to be part of the previously reported plan to slash around 30,000 jobs.

Kashmir turns to winter wonderland, heavy snow blankets roads, rooftops. See picsHeavy snowfall has transformed the Kashmir Valley into a winter wonderland, officials said, with the ski resort of Gulmarg and higher-altitude areas in Kupwara, Baramulla, and Shopian blanketed in fresh snow. The white cover has turned roads, fields, and rooftops into icy spectacles, drawing awe from residents and visitors alike. On Thursday, many parts of the Valley plains, including Srinagar, were lashed by rain and strong winds, which uprooted trees at multiple locations and prompted precautionary power shutdowns.

Trump withdraws Canada's Board of Peace invite after Carney's Davos speechUS President Donald Trump's aboutface follows Canada PM Mark Carney's speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, where he openly decried powerful nations using economic integration as weapons and tariffs as leverage. Carney's office had said last week that he had been invited to serve on the board and that he planned to accept the invitation.

With a strong game sense and appetite for runs, Rinku may end up being the final piece in India's batting order.

sports.headline: Bangladesh cricket in crisis: What next after T20 World Cup boycott? Bangladesh have maintained their stance on not playing the T20 World Cup in India due to security concerns, but a withdrawal could bring serious complications.

Bangladesh Boycotts T20 World Cup In India Over Security Concerns; Scotland To Join Tournament This special report details the unprecedented decision by the Bangladesh interim government to boycott the T20 World Cup in India. The speaker notes, 'Bangladesh has clearly chosen politics over cricket at this point of time, boycotting the T20 World Cup despite the ICC security assurances.' The fallout of this decision is immediate, with Scotland set to replace Bangladesh as the highest-ranked non-qualified team. The report highlights that the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) lost an ICC board vote 14-2 regarding a venue change, with only Pakistan supporting them. Tensions reportedly escalated after the BCCI requested Kolkata Knight Riders to release Mustafizur Rahman. Despite the ICC providing security guarantees, the interim government cited 'genuine security risks' and a preference for the tournament to be moved to Sri Lanka. This marks the first time a team has boycotted an entire ICC tournament, leaving the future of Bangladesh cricket in a precarious position as the global tournament faces significant controversy.

Cunning? Pakistan stoke controversy in U19 World Cup with slow chase vs Zimbabwe U19 World Cup 2026: Pakistan deliberately slowed their run chase against Zimbabwe in their final league match on Thursday, January 22. The outcome improved their net run rate for the Super Six stage and ended Scotland's qualification hopes, raising questions over fair play.

You'll never walk alone: Liverpool fans back Ibrahima Konate after father's passing Liverpool fans rallied around Ibrahima Konate after the defender confirmed his father's passing. Konate's absence from the Champions League clash against Marseille was later explained as he dealt with the personal loss.

2nd T20I preview: All eyes on Rinku Singh as India settle on World Cup combination India vs New Zealand: Rinku Singh will be in focus when India take on New Zealand in their 2nd T20I of the series in Raipur. As India settle into their combination, this could turn out to be a golden chance for the batter to fix his place in the playing XI.

More than a finisher, is Rinku final piece of India's puzzle for T20 World Cup? Often considered as a finisher in the Indian team, Rinku Singh offers more luxury to the team management to use him as the perfect utility man in the batting order. With a strong game sense and appetite for runs, Rinku may end up being the final piece in India's batting order.

Abhishek Sharma will be most impactful player of T20 World Cup: Shastri India opener Abhishek Sharma will be the one to watch out for, believes Ravi Shastri. Sharma has been in sensational touch in T20I cricket and has dominated every opposition he has batted against.

Day 6 Live: Carlos Alcaraz in action, Medvedev stages epic fightback Australian Open, Day 6 Live Updates: The World number 1, Carlos Alcaraz has started strong in his Round 3 clash against Corentin Moutet at the Rod Laver Arena, bagging the first set to his name with rather ease. On the other hand, Daniil Medvedev is setting up what can be yet another epic fightback from the Russian after losing the first two sets against Fabian Marozan. Previously, Aryna Sabalenka clinched a thrilling win against Anastasia Potapova.

Gujarat Giants end losing streak as sloppy UP Warriorz implode WPL 2026, UPW vs GGW: Ash Gardner's Gujarat Giants went to second in the table after beating Meg Lanning's UP Warriorz by 45 runs on Thursday in Vadodara. Rajeshwari Gayakwad won the Player of the Match award for her three-wicket haul.
Casemiro to leave Manchester United at the end of the season Manchester United's Casemiro has confirmed his exit at the end of the season. His departure ends a successful four-year spell at the club.

Bangladesh vs ICC: Did Pakistan incite team's T20 World Cup boycott? Bangladesh remained firm in their stance of boycotting the T20 World Cup in India. It was a huge call considering the country might be thrown out of the tournament. Did Pakistan play a key part in triggering this problem?

Frosty handshake: Fiery Naomi Osaka, Sorana Cirstea share cold exchange in heated clashNaomi Osaka and Sorana Cirstea's second-round clash at the 2026 Australian Open sparked controversy after a brief, tense handshake and on-court tension. In the post-match press conference, Osaka also apologised for being disrespectful.

Vikram Sathaye On ICC Voting 14-2 Against Bangladesh's Demand To Play In Sri LankaOn this news bulletin, sports analyst Vikram Sathaye discusses the escalating tension between the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) and the International Cricket Council (ICC). Addressing the host Gaurav, Vikram confirms that the window for Bangladesh to play in Sri Lanka has effectively closed, stating, 'The ship has sailed, Gaurav. In fact, yesterday, when the ICC voted 14-2 in favour of retaining the original schedule, it meant that Bangladesh's demand wasn't met.' The discussion highlights the BCB Chairman Aminul Islam's reaction to a 24-hour ultimatum provided by the ICC and the internal conflict regarding government involvement in the decision-making process. Vikram points out the contradiction in Islam's statements, noting that while the Chairman initially requested time to consult the government, he later questioned the ICC's authority to issue an ultimatum. The segment also touches upon the safety concerns and national prestige associated with the team, particularly following Mustafizur's exclusion from the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Calls Grow In Pakistan To Boycott T20 World Cup In Solidarity With BangladeshThis news report highlights the growing social media commentary in Pakistan calling for the nation to boycott the T20 World Cup in solidarity with Bangladesh. Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has spearheaded these calls, accusing the International Cricket Council (ICC) of making a 'political move' that is 'too pro-India'. Latif stated, 'If Bangladesh doesn't play, then Pakistan won't play either,' while warning of potential threats to cricketers in India. He argued that the ICC has failed to protect Bangladeshi players and believes Pakistan must seize this opportunity to challenge the current global cricket order. Latif further claimed that without the high-stakes India-Pakistan clash, 'half the World Cup will anyways collapse.' Despite these calls, the report notes there are currently no formal grounds for Pakistan to withdraw, especially as their matches are scheduled in Sri Lanka under a hybrid model. The programme examines the potential impact of such a boycott on the tournament's stability.

Stubbs, Rickelton called up as injury concerns rattle South AfricaSouth Africa face a challenging T20 World Cup 2026 build-up as injuries rule out key batters De Zorzi, Ferreira, and potentially Miller, prompting replacements Rickelton, Stubbs, and Hermann.

Bangladesh Boycotts T20 World Cup In India Over Security Concerns; Scotland To Replace TeamOn this Special Report, the focus is on the Bangladesh cricket team's decision to boycott the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The decision follows the International Cricket Council's (ICC) rejection of a plea to shift Bangladesh's matches to Sri Lanka, a proposal that was defeated 14-2 in a board vote. The speaker notes, 'The Bangladesh interim government had a chance to put cricket ahead of their shallow ego and politics but the latter eclipsed better sense and logic.' Bangladesh cited security concerns for its players and fans as the primary reason for the boycott, claiming a lack of fresh assurances from the BCCI or the Indian government. Consequently, Scotland, the highest-ranked non-qualified team, will replace Bangladesh in the tournament starting 7th February. The report highlights that this is the first time a team has boycotted an entire ICC tournament, leaving Bangladesh cricket in a precarious position following tensions linked to the release of Mustafizur Rehman from the Kolkata Knight Riders.

Novak Djokovic nears special 400, Jannik Sinner hammers James DuckworthNovak Djokovic advanced smoothly to the Australian Open third round, but it was Jannik Sinner who stole the spotlight with another dominant display. While veterans like Stan Wawrinka and Marin Cilic rolled back the years. Madison Keys, Iga Swiatek, and Naomi Osaka also progressed.

Pick me knock continues: Sarfaraz slams 17th First-Class century on Ranji returnMumbai gained control on Day 1 of their Ranji Trophy clash with Hyderabad as Sarfaraz Khan and Siddhesh Lad both struck centuries, recovering from early setbacks and guiding their team to a strong position by stumps.

What Gautam Gambhir meant by his puzzling reply to Shashi TharoorGautam Gambhir's reply to Shashi Tharoor took an unexpected tangent. We decode what he said, why it struck a chord, and the pressures that shaped a cryptic response.

RCB sale: Indian businessman Adar Poonawalla confirms strong bid for IPL teamIndian billionaire Adar Poonawalla has confirmed that he is launching a strong bid to acquire Indian Premier League franchise RCB. Ponawalla took to X to confirm his interest.

England's Ashes review claims first victim: Luke Wright steps down as selectorEngland's post-Ashes review has claimed its first victim as selector Luke Wright has decided to step down from his role. Wright will leave his post after the T20 World Cup 2026.

Shubman Gill makes horror Ranji Trophy return, out for 0 against SaurashtraShubman Gill's turbulent run continued as the Indian Test captain returned to Ranji Trophy cricket with a two-ball duck at No. 5 against Saurashtra on Thursday at the Niranjan Shah Stadium Ground C in Rajkot.

Nikhil Naaz On Bangladesh Out Of T20 World Cup: 'Politics Is Winning This Round'On this Special Report, sports editor Nikhil Naaz discusses the official confirmation that Bangladesh will miss the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. The decision follows the ICC's rejection of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's plea for a hybrid model, leading to Scotland taking their place. Nikhil Naaz observed, 'Whatever was spoken there, I don't want to mention this. That is just between the players and us,' referring to the lack of transparency regarding the Bangladeshi government's talks with its players. The discussion highlights how political turmoil has turned a global tournament into a diplomatic flashpoint, marking the first time a team has been removed from a World Cup by the ICC. Naaz notes that while India maintains its stance as a safe host, the real losers are the cricketers whose dreams are sidelined by political standoff. The programme also touches upon the strained cricketing ties in the Asian circuit, involving Pakistan and the future of the Asia Cup.

In Quotes: Why Bangladesh decided to boycott T20 World CupBangladesh has decided to boycott the T20 World Cup in India due to unresolved security concerns. The BCB demands shifting the tournament matches to Sri Lanka to ensure player safety and fair participation.

Pakistan instigating Bangladesh with T20 WC snub and bring India down: Madan LalIndian legend Madan Lal has claimed that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to go ahead with the T20 World Cup boycott to bring India down. The Bangladesh Cricket Board announced on Thursday, January 22, that they have decided to snub the World Cup.

Madan Lal Slams Bangladesh's 'Foolish' Decision To Boycott World Cup In IndiaOn this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Madan Lal reacts to the Bangladesh Cricket Board's decision to boycott the upcoming World Cup in India. Madan Lal describes the move as 'foolish' and 'a stupid decision', suggesting that Bangladesh stands to lose significantly from a commercial and financial standpoint. He alleges that Pakistan is instigating Bangladesh to undermine India's position in global cricket. The discussion highlights the ICC's 14-2 vote in favour of the tournament proceeding in India, despite Bangladesh's security concerns. Madan Lal emphasizes that while the 'show will go on' with potential replacements like Scotland or Zimbabwe, the decision will severely impact the players who 'die for an opportunity to play in a World Cup'. He further warns that such political interference could have long-term repercussions for the Asian Cricket Council and the future of the game in the region.

Atul Vasan Slams Bangladesh's T20 World Cup Boycott: 'They Didn't See Through The Endgame'On this India Today special report, former Indian cricketer Atul Vasan reacts to the Bangladesh government's decision to boycott the upcoming T20 World Cup in India. Vasan criticises the move as a 'rash decision', stating, 'I think it's quite funny because they actually didn't see through the endgame'. He argues that Bangladesh has 'cut their nose to spite the face' by mixing politics with cricket over safety concerns and IPL snubs. Vasan supports the BCCI and ICC for refusing to shift matches out of India, noting that the logistical challenges would be a 'nightmare'. He further suggests that Scotland could replace Bangladesh in the tournament, dismissing the impact of potential support for the boycott from Pakistan. The discussion highlights the shift in the global cricket order and the financial influence of India in the current revenue model, concluding that Bangladesh's absence will not significantly affect the tournament's competitive nature.

Won't play in India: Bangladesh boycott T20 World Cup, ICC to name replacementThe Bangladesh Cricket Board on Thursday remained firm in its stance, saying it won't play in India. The ICC, on Wednesday, rejected Bangladesh's request to change the venues, dismissing concerns of security threat for Bangladesh players in India.

Rohit Sharma conferred with honourary doctorate by Ajeenkya DY Patil UniversityFormer India captain Rohit Sharma received an honorary doctorate from Ajeenkya DY Patil University. The award recognises his leadership and significant contribution to Indian cricket.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
